title: Fire inspections data set overview
text:
Code
library(readr)
library(inspectdf)
library(stringr)
library(forcats)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
#library(ggsankey)
#library(lubridate)
Fire Inspections data was downloaded in csv format from the ODP on Oct 10, 2020 to obtain a snapshot of published data after completion of the entire data processing pipeline.

title: Fire Inspections Overview
text:
Overview
The imported data set includes 16 variables and 5636 annual inspection records. Nine variables originate in the ingested data, and seven (X, Y, InspWithinLastYear, address_id, lon, lat, ObjectId) from data enrichment and processing activities.


Code
inspections




  



When imported, variables in the data set were assigned data types based on constituent data. Though fundamentally a logical variable, ‘InspWithinLastYear’ was treated as a factor to retain display of the labels ‘Yes’ and ‘No’.


Code
inspect_types(inspections) %>% show_plot()






Null value prevalence


Code
inspect_na(inspections) %>% show_plot()







Code
# Remove 'ANNUAL ' from InspectionType_Full text strings for chart and plot
tmp_inspections <- inspections
tmp_inspections$InspectionType_Full <- str_sub(tmp_inspections$InspectionType_Full, 8, -1)
tmp_inspections %>% count(InspectionType_Full, sort=TRUE)




  





Code
ggplot(tmp_inspections, aes(x = fct_infreq(InspectionType_Full))) + 
  geom_bar() + labs(x="Annual Inspection Type", y="Count") + coord_flip()







Code
inspections %>% count(propusetype, sort=TRUE)




  





Code
ggplot(inspections, aes(x = fct_infreq(propusetypedescription))) + 
  geom_bar() + coord_flip()







Code

Code
inspections %>% count(InspWithinLastYear, sort=TRUE)




  



Code

  geom_bar()







Code

Code

Code

text: To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Preparing ODP data for discovery through Data.gov
text:
The Data.gov website serves as a centralized data catalog the public can use to discover public data. The primary focus is federal data though state and local governments and NGOs are invited to have catalog, data set, and data distribution metadata included in the catalog. To do so, organizations can sign up to have metadata harvested through a DCAT-US 1.1 compliant API. DCAT-US schema version 1.1 metadata requirements are published on resources.data.gov. The json-ld schema for DCAT 1.1 is available at the URL https://project-open-data.cio.gov/v1.1/schema/catalog.jsonld.
Through ArcGIS Online (AGO), the ODP has an JSON endpoint that meets Data.gov format requirements. AGO therefore provides an approach to having ODP data included in the Data.gov catalog fairly easily (see figure). Additions, updates, and deletions to the Data.gov catalog occur through the harvest source rather than within Data.gov directly. Data.gov synchronizes changes daily through a harvest job.

title: AGO-DCAT-Data.gov
section: Requirements for adding non-federal government data to Data.gov
text:
Requirements for adding non-federal government data to Data.gov Github issue #1168 provides an overview of steps required to have Detroit’s ODP metadata harvested by Data.gov. flowchart LR A[(AGO
geodatabase)] -. exposes DCATA-US v1.1
metadata .-> B[[1 Catalog record
containing
many Dataset records]] -. harvested by
Data.gov .-> C[(Data.gov
catalog)] Second diagram flowchart TB subgraph Catalog_Record direction LR d1[[Dataset
record 1]] d2[[Dataset
record 2]] d3[[Dataset
record n]] end A[(AGO
geodatabase)] -. exposes DCATA-US v1.1
metadata .-> Catalog_Record -. harvested by
Data.gov .-> C[(Data.gov
catalog)] The article “How to get your Open Data on Data.gov” provides instructions for having Open Data harvested by Data.gov and includes details specific to non-federal governments. In brief, requirements for adding local government data that would need to be completed are: A data.json endpoint that can be harvested by the Data.gov catalog with metadata that meets minimum criteria required of non-federal government entities. DCAT-US schema version 1.1 metadata requirements are published on resources.data.gov. The jsonld schema URL for DCAT 1.1 is https://project-open-data.cio.gov/v1.1/schema/catalog.jsonld. To do: Develop a terms of use / data policy for data sets shared through the Detroit Open Data Portal. To be in compliance with data.gov requirements, this policy should be accessible via a stable URL. For review: Identify a single point of contact to which/whom data.gov staff can refer questions about Detroit data sets. This point of contact should be able to triage questions about Detroit data. To do: Ensure every data set meets the minimum metadata requirements. To help with this, metadata can be validated using a .json catalog endpoint or by file upload at https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/validate . Preliminary results from an initial validation of our catalog are being analyzed. To do: Review metadata and text formatting of metadata entries as shared through the DCAT json endpoint available from AGO. Special attention should be paid to metadata added with html formatting in ‘description’ fields. To do: Evaluate the interpretability of local metadata in the broader Data.gov context. To do: Review the catalog of data sets available via our JSON endpoint and determine if all are appropriate to share via Data.gov. If any data set is not suitable to share through the catalog, methods to exclude such datasets would need to be identified and implemented.

title: AGO-DCAT-Data.gov
section: Information required when registering to have local data added to Data.gov
text:
Information required when registering to have local data added to Data.gov
Local governments and others are invited sign up to have local data federated to Data.gov.
When doing so, the following information is requested:

Name of the governement entity
Name and email address of individual requesting to have data catalog included
Data Catalog Data.json URL
Data Catalog Terms of Use URL
Additionally, details about data included in the catalog from other sources such as the Federal Government, State Government, or a non-profit is requested.

title: Preparing ODP data for discovery through Data.gov
section: Adding local government data to Data.gov
text:
Adding local government data to Data.gov
The article “How to get your Open Data on Data.gov” provides instructions for having Open Data harvested by Data.gov and includes details specific to non-federal data publishers.
At a local level, a number of recommended policy, quality assurance, and related steps have been identified through review of our metadata and other local data resources. An overview of recommendations developed to date follow. Progress on the recommendations is being tracked on Github.

Steps to ensure metadata meets local and Data.gov publishing criteria [DRAFT]

Develop a terms of use / data policy for data sets shared through the Detroit Open Data Portal. To be in compliance with data.gov requirements, this policy should be accessible via a stable URL.
Identify a single point of contact to which/whom data.gov staff can refer questions about Detroit data sets. This point of contact should be able to triage questions about Detroit data.
Ensure every data set meets the minimum metadata requirements. To help with this, metadata can be validated using a .json catalog endpoint or by file upload at https://labs.data.gov/dashboard/validate. Results from an initial validation of our catalog were analyzed and issues to be remedied are available on GitHub. Moving forward, validation checks should be repeated periodically or continuously as developing metadata procedures are instituted.
Steps to help ensure metadata associated with newly published data meets the Data.gov standard should be integrated into data publication workflows and instructions.
In some cases, element-level metadata of the type that would be included in a data dictionary has been directly entered in the data set description fields on AGO. As metadata processes and standards are formalized, it may be helpful to review metadata displays and available alternatives. In collaboration with data stewards and other stakeholders, benefits and limitations of retrospectively reformatting metadata could be reviewed.
Evaluate the interpretability of local metadata in broader contexts such as Data.gov context.
Review the catalog of data sets available via our JSON endpoint and determine if all are appropriate to share via Data.gov. If any data set is not suitable to share through the catalog, methods to exclude such data sets, and how this would impact data published through the ODP would need to be identified and taken into account.







Tip



Github issue #1168 and related sub-issues are being used to track progress on recommendations.

Additionally, details about data included in the catalog from other sources such as the Federal Government, State Government, or a non-profit is requested.

title: Metadata exemplar
section: HTML Preview and Google Rich Results Test
text:
HTML Preview and Google Rich Results Test
An HTML display mockup with embedded schema.org “dataset” and “distribution” metadata presents an early glimpse of the potential for a static HTML file to present metadata. The schema.org metadata schema was selected because Google Search, including Google Data Search, relies on structured data embedded in websites that adheres to the schema.org vocabulary. This vocabulary, like the DCAT-US v1.1 vocabulary, is based on the W3C Data Catalog Vocabulary (DCAT) standard.
Results from the Google “Rich Results Test” for our HTML display mockup show that in addition to the “Dataset” and “Distribution” metadata, the structured format of variable-level metadata (column or variable name and description) is also identified.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   <div>The City of Detroit receives Fire Insurance Escrow (FIE) funds pursuant to the <a href='https://www.michigan.gov/difs/0,5269,7-303-13648_60666_77179---,00.html' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Fire Insurance Withholding Program, administered by The State of Michigan</a>. Under\n the program, the City of Detroit receives a portion of the insured's \ninsurance payment to be held in an escrow account until the relevant \nstructure is repaired, replaced, or demolished, at which time the FIE \nfunds would be released by the City of Detroit to the insured. </div><div><br /></div><div>All\n current property owners may be eligible to receive the balance on their\n property. To inquire, please contact the Buildings, Safety Engineering,\n and Environmental Department (BSEED).</div><div><br /></div><div><div><b><u><i>Contact</i></u></b></div><div>(313) 224-2733</div><div><br /></div><div><a href='https://detroitmi.gov/departments/buildings-safety-engineering-and-environmental-department' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Buildings, Safety Engineering, and Environmental Department (BSEED</a>)</div><div>Coleman A. Young Municipal Center</div><div>2 Woodward Avenue, 4th Floor</div><div>Detroit, MI 48226</div></div>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Annual Life Safety Fire Inspections are conducted by the Detroit Fire Department (DFD) Fire Marshall Division in accordance with Chapter 18 of the Detroit City Code, the Detroit Fire Prevention and Protection Code.  Inspections occur as a part of routine daily district work in support of the core mission of the DFD Fire Marshall Division "to provide the citizens and visitors of Detroit with the highest level of fire prevention using standards and guidelines set forth by the Michigan Building Code, City Ordinance and the NFPA (National Fire Protection Association)".  Inspections are also conducted to fulfill City of Detroit (CoD) Business Licensing requirements. Business owners required to obtain or renew a CoD Business License from Buildings, Safety Engineering, and Environment Department (BSEED) must get a Fire Permit from the Fire Marshall division as a part of the licensing process. The Permit certifies that the business premises have undergone and passed a Life Safety Fire Inspection within the past 12 months.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 A Certificate of Compliance is issued by the Buildings, Safety, Engineering, and Environmental Department (BSEED) for commercial properties within the City of Detroit that have met all life safety and code requirements. Once obtained, a Commercial Certificate of Compliance is valid for two years from date of issuance. A Certificate of Compliance must be obtained for all commercial buildings and structures in the City of Detroit, whether active or vacant. All inspections & processes are conducted in accordance with the provisions of the City of Detroit Property Maintenance Code, Chapter 8 of the <a href='https://library.municode.com/mi/detroit/codes/code_of_ordinances' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Detroit City Code</a> and the City of Detroit Zoning Ordinance, Chapter 50 of the <a href='https://library.municode.com/mi/detroit/codes/code_of_ordinances' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Detroit City Code</a>. This data set is limited to currently valid Certificates of Compliance.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Map of all local historic districts in the City of Detroit that is updated regularly and intended to be used for reference purposes only. Each local historic district is enacted by an ordinance containing a legal boundary description and elements of design. To obtain a copy of an ordinance, please consult <a href='https://library.municode.com/mi/detroit/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIVDECO_CH21HI' rel='nofollow ugc' target='_blank'>Chapter 21 of the 2019 Detroit City Code</a> or contact the <a href='https://detroitmi.gov/government/city-clerk' rel='nofollow ugc' target='_blank'>Clerk's Office</a>. Please note that all work conducted within a local historic district (construction, alteration, demolition, site work, etc.) requires review and approval by the <a href='https://detroitmi.gov/hdc' rel='nofollow ugc' target='_blank'>Historic District Commission</a>.<div><br /></div><div>For more information about final reports or proposed local historic districts currently under study, please visit the <a href='https://detroitmi.gov/hdab' rel='nofollow ugc' target='_blank'>Historic Designation Advisory Board webpage</a> or contact staff at (313) 224-3487.</div><div><br /></div><div><strong>Column Definitions</strong><br /><strong>OBJECTID: </strong>Unique identifier for each record within this dataset.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>Name:</b> Name of the Local Historic District</div><div><br /></div><div><b>Section:</b> The corresponding section within Chapter 21 of the City's Code of Ordinances.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>Year_Enacted</b>: The day and year that the Local Historic District designation was enacted by the Detroit City Council for this area. Note: the time of day is not precise.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>Report_Link</b>: Link to a report written by the Historic Designation Advisory Board that defines the boundaries of the area and describes the area's history. Historic districts enacted prior to 1976 do not have corresponding final reports.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>GlobalID:</b> Unique identifier for each record within this dataset across geodatabases.</div><div><br /></div><div><b>Interior Designation:</b> This field indicates if any interior alterations also require review and approval by the Historic District Commission. If it is blank, then only exterior alterations are reviewed.</div>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             <div>The City of Detroit’s Civil Rights, Inclusion & Opportunity Department (CRIO) runs the Detroit Business Opportunity Program (DBOP). It processes applications, maintains an online register, and annually certifies and recertifies Detroit Based Businesses (DBB), Detroit Headquartered Businesses (DHB), Detroit Resident Businesses (DRB), Detroit Small Businesses (DSB), Detroit Based Micro Businesses (DBMB), Detroit Start-Ups (DSU), Minority-Owned Business Enterprises (MBE), and Woman-Owned Business Enterprises (WBE). Depending on the certification, businesses qualify for the following benefits: appreciation events, networking and capacity building opportunities, equalization credits, and visibility on the register. </div><div> </div><div>This dataset is the list of businesses with one or more active certifications from the Detroit Business Opportunity Program.</div><div> </div><div>For more information about CRIO’s Detroit Business Opportunity Program, please click <a href='https://detroitmi.gov/departments/civil-rights-inclusion-opportunity-department/detroit-business-opportunity-program' rel='nofollow ugc' style='color:blue;' target='_blank'>here</a>.  </div><div> </div><div>See <a href='https://detroitmi.gov/sites/detroitmi.localhost/files/2018-02/NIGP%20Commodity%20Codes%20List.pdf' rel='nofollow ugc' style='color:blue;' target='_blank'>here</a> for a breakdown of the codes in the ‘nigp_code’ column.</div>

23  <span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'>This dataset reflects all citizen complaints received by the Detroit Police Department (DPD) and the Board of Police Commissioners from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2018. The data are provided by the Office of the Chief Investigator (OCI), under the direction of the Board of Police Commissioners. The OCI receives, investigates, and resolves complaints regarding non-criminal allegations of misconduct against the DPD and its personnel. </span><br /><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'>This dataset contains information about the nature of individual complaints, demographics for both the citizen filing the complaint and the officer against which the complaint is filed, and the resulting finding from the OCI investigation. In order to protect the privacy of both the officer and the citizen filing the complaint, no personally-identifiable information is displayed.</span><br /><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'>As each case is allotted 90 days to complete an investigation, the dataset will be updated monthly with information from 90 days prior. For example, June 2016 data will be uploaded in early October 2016.</span><br /><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'>Should you have questions about this dataset, you may contact the Office of the Chief Investigator at (313) 596-2499 or go to their website at: </span><a href='http://www.detroitmi.gov/How-Do-I/File/Chief-Investigator-Complaints' rel='nofollow ugc' style='box-sizing:border-box; color:rgb(34, 121, 166); text-decoration-line:none; font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;' target='_blank'>http://www.detroitmi.gov/How-Do-I/File/Chief-Investigator-Complaints</a><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'>.</span><br /><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><b>Field Descriptions</b></span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>BPC or Board of Police Commissioners number:</i> a unique identifier issued by the BPC to each case in numerical order after the case has been assigned to an Investigator, used for internal tracking purposes.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>CCR or Citizen Complaint Report number:</i> the unique identifier automatically assigned to the case via the data management system.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Report Date:<b> </b></i>date the complaint was filed.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Entry:</i> mode of entry for the complaint by the citizen.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Age:</i> age of the citizen filing the complaint.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>ctznRace:</i> race of the citizen filing the complaint.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>ctznSex:</i> sex of the citizen filing the complaint.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Closed:</i> date the investigation was completed by OCI.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Unit:<b> </b></i>commanding unit of the officer against which the complaint was filed.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Administrative Closure:</i> administrative finding.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Allegation:</i> a claim as set forth by the citizen complaint.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>Finding:</i> the disposition of a citizen complaint after investigation.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>ofcrRace:</i> race of the officer against which the complaint was filed.</span><br /><span style='color:rgb(94, 94, 94); font-family:"Open Sans", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;'><i>ofcrSex:</i> sex of the officer against which the complaint was filed.</span><br /><br /><div><div><b>Allegation Type Descriptions</b></div><div><i>Arrest:</i> Complaint that the restraint of a person’s liberty was improper or unjustified.</div><div><i>Demeanor:</i> Complaint regarding a DPD member’s bearing, gesture, language, or other action, which is offensive or of doubtful social propriety, or gives the appearance of conflict of interest, misuse of influence, or lack of jurisdiction or authority.</div><div><i>Entry: </i>Complaint that entry into a building or onto property was improper and/or that excessive force was used against property to gain entry.</div><div><i>Force:</i> Complaint regarding the use or threatened use of force against a person.</div><div><i>Harassment:</i> Complaint that the method of police action was predicated upon factors irrelevant under the circumstances to good law enforcement decision-making (e.g., race, attire, sex, age) or complaint of improperly selective law enforcement on the basis of factors just listed.</div><div><i>Procedure:</i> Complaint regarding other actions in violation of DPD rules, regulations, procedures or policies, or the Law Enforcement Code of Ethics.</div><div>Property: Complaint regarding property lost or damaged while in police custody or confiscated through police action.</div><div><i>Search:</i> Complaint that the search of a person or his/her property was improper, or in violation of established police procedure, or unjustified.</div><div><i>Service: </i>Complaint regarding the lack, tardiness or inadequacy of police service.</div><div><br /></div><div><b><font size='3'>Finding Type Descriptions</font></b></div><div><i>Unfounded</i>: The investigation revealed no facts to support that the incident complained of actually occurred.</div><div><i>Sustained:</i> A preponderance of the evidence shows that the alleged conduct did occur and the actions of the officer violated DPD policies, procedures, or training.</div><div><i>Not Sustained:</i> There are insufficient facts to decide whether the alleged misconduct occurred.</div><div><i>Exonerated:</i> A preponderance of the evidence shows that the alleged conduct did occur but did not violate DPD policies, procedures or training.</div></div>

                                                                                        This dataset contains a record for each state licensed child care provider operating in Detroit. It is derived from <a href='https://gis-michigan.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/Michigan::child-care-1/about' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>this dataset</a> from the State of Michigan's Open Data Portal.<div><br /></div><div>Technical Notes:</div><div><ul><li>Locations were included for this Detroit subset of data if their reported city (City), and matched city (StdCity) were both "Detroit". </li><li>Zip codes were cleaned to be only 5 digits.</li><li>From the original dataset, both "StdStreetAddress" and "StdZip" were used for this dataset as "Address" and "Zip" respectively.</li><li>Latitude and Longitude represent the <a href='https://base-units-detroitmi.hub.arcgis.com/' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Base Unit</a> address location, and Address ID represents the Base Unit address key.</li></ul>Coordinate System: WGS 84 (EPSG: 4326) <br /></div>

                                <div>A table of all addresses in \nthe city. These addresses are purely descriptive and do not have an \ninherent location. They acquire their location from the physical base \nunits that they are linked to through the parcel_id, building_id, \nunit_id, and street_id fields.</div><div><span><br /></span></div><div><span>This table serves as the base for the <a href='https://base-units-detroitmi.hub.arcgis.com/datasets/d256d05395ae441493dd1b879a834601_0' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Address Points</a> view\n and incorporates information from the other tables to build an address \npoint list which can be used to make a map or in a geocoding service.</span></div><div><span><br /></span></div><div><span><span style='font-weight:bold;'>Fields</span><br /></span></div><div><span><span style='font-style:italic;'>addr_id: </span>The unique ID for this address.</span><br /><span><span><span style='font-style:italic;'>{unit, parcel, bldg, street}_id: </span>The unique ID for the corresponding physical base unit: a <span style='font-weight:bold;'>unit/parcel/building/street.</span></span></span></div><div><span><br /></span></div><div><span><span style='font-weight:bold;'>Geometry type</span><br /></span></div><div>There is no geometry on this table. <span><br /></span></div>
31                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      A table of the addresses in the city with their location represented as points. <div><br /></div><div>When\n an address is related to a unit, its location is the center point of \nthe building that unit is related to. In the future, this location may \nbe upgraded to be the rooftop location of that unit within the building.</div><div>When an address describes a building and not a unit, the location is the center point of the related building.</div><div>When an address is only related to a parcel, its location is the center point of that related parcel.<div><br /></div><div><div><span style='font-weight:bold;'>Fields</span><br /></div><div><span style='font-style:italic;'>addr_id: </span>The unique ID for this address.</div></div><div><div><i>{unit, parcel, bldg, street}_id:</i> The unique ID for the corresponding physical base unit: <b>a unit/parcel/building/street.</b></div></div><div><i>geo_source:</i> The physical base unit that this address got its location from.</div><div><br /></div><div><br /></div><div><div><span style='font-weight:bold;'>Geometry type</span><br /></div><div>The geometry is a Point in the <a href='https://epsg.io/2898' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>EPSG:2898 projection</a>.</div></div></div>
32                                      <div><b><font size='4' style='font-family:inherit;'>For more information please the </font></b><a href='https://detroitmi.gov/departments/department-public-works/maps-and-records' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Maps and Records website.</a></div><div><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b><font size='4' style='font-family:inherit;'>Data Description</font></b></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>This encroachment data is intended as a reference material of encroachments, but not designed for survey, accurate positioning, or legal documents. It is created as polygon feature class, including information of petitioner’s name, current property owner, petition approval date, encroachment type, property address, and citations of Journal of City Council (J.C.C.). The raster layer version of <i>Linen Map Markup Mosaic</i> and the <i>Detroit parcel layer</i> are used to create this data.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>The encroachment records begin at 1927 throughout the whole city, and it will be updated weekly, until it contains all information up to date. The most recent recorded encroachments are ready to view, and all encroachments need to be validated after all historical records are digitized. The authors are working on updating the database. </div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b><font size='4' style='font-family:inherit;'>Attribute Fields</font></b></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Petitioner Name</b>: The petitioner’s name of encroachment, it could be commercial or private petitioner, multiple petitioners for one encroachment are accepted.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Owner Name</b>: The current owner of property where encroachment exits. It could be commercial or private owner. The citation of current owner of parcels are recorded on <i>BS&A online</i> and <i>Wayne County Register of Deeds</i>.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Encroachment Type</b>: Types of encroachment, such as berm use, planters, underground utility, steps, etc. </div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Type Code</b>: Classified encroachment types</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><ul><li>1 - Structural Overhang, feature hanging over ROW attached to a structure but is not physically connected to the ROW surface. (Awnings (no pillars), signs, design features on structures)</li><li>2 - Structural Above Grade, feature attached to a structure and is secured to the surface of a ROW. (Awnings with pillars, stairs or ramps leading to a structure)</li><li>3 - Structural Below Grade, feature attached to a structure and is located below the surface of a ROW. (Vaults, basements)</li><li>4 - Above Grade, feature that is not attached to a structure, appears above grade, and is secured to the surface of a ROW. (Bollards, bike racks, electrical/telecommunication cabinets)</li><li>5 - Below Grade, feature that is not attached to a structure and is located below the surface of a ROW. (Conduits, piping, monitoring wells)</li><li>6 - Land use, an area used for landscaping, decorative paving, berm parking or the placement of features not secured to the ROW.</li><li>7- Temporary Closure of a ROW.</li></ul></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Address</b>: The current address of property where encroachment exits. The citation of property address of parcels are recorded on <i>BS&A online</i> and <i>Wayne County Register of Deeds</i>.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Note</b>: Description of encroachment. Size, scale, and material information of encroachment are included. </div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>J.C.C. Date</b>: The approval date of encroachment recorded on J.C.C.  “Null” of the field represents the J.C.C. information was missed in the book. "Pending" means the encroachment is being processing.<br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>J.C.C. Page</b>: The page number of J.C.C. page recorded on the Encroachment Books. “Null” of the field represents the J.C.C. information was missed in the book.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Renewal</b>: The validation of recorded encroachments. Including already renewed encroachment or needs to be renewed encroachment, since encroachment petition cannot be transferred to the new owner once the property is rebuilt or sold. (This field will be updated after all historical recorded encroachments are digitized.)</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Review</b>: Refer to any comments.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Review ID</b>: Unique ID generated for each feature.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><font size='4' style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Data Reference</b></font></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>Linen Map Markup Mosaic</i>, updated by Ted Schultz, published on https://detroitmi.maps.arcgis.com.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>Detroit Parcel Layer</i>, updated by Assessors Office.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>Encroachment Books</i>, kept by Department of Public Work, City Engineering.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>OpenGov</i>, detroitmi.viewpointcloud.com<b><span style='font-family:Arial, sans-serif; font-size:10pt; color:black;'></span></b></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>BS&A online</i>, current owner and property address can be searched by parcel number on https://bsaonline.com.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>Wayne County Register of Deeds</i>, current owner and property address can be searched by parcel number on https://www.waynecountylandrecords.com.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><i>Pictometry EagleView</i>, providing oblique high-resolution imagery from different angle to help identify existed encroachment, https://explorer.pictometry.com.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><font size='4' style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Spatial Reference</b></font></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><font size='3' style='font-family:inherit;'>WGS 1984 Web Mercator Auxiliary Sphere</font><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><font size='4' style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Disclaimers</b></font></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>This data is created by Maps and Records Bureau using multiple base maps. While we make every reasonable effort to ensure the accuracy of the information, some of the information may not be complete, and may contain inaccuracies or errors. We do not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of the information acquired from the data reference. We accept no responsibility or liability for the inaccurate measurements of the data, for examples, compared to current field measurements, and/or not aligned with high resolution aerial images.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>If you need to verify other information relates to the data, please let us know by contacting us at: mapsandrecordsbureau@detroitmi.gov</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div>

                                                                                                                                                                                       <p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif;'>For more information please visit the </span><a href='https://detroitmi.gov/departments/department-public-works/maps-and-records' style='font-family:"Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size:15px;' target='_blank' rel='nofollow ugc noopener noreferrer'>Maps and Records website.</a></p><p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif;'><br /></span></p><p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif;'>This data is intended as a reference material of street and alley vacations, but not designed for survey, accurate positioning, or legal documents. It is created as polygon feature class, vacation information based on field measurements, types of Right of Way, and citations of Journal of the Common Council (J.C.C.) and the plat Liber and Page is listed under the column titled 'Sub_Plat</span><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif;'>'</span><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif;'>. The paper maps of the Street and Alley Vacation, the raster layer version of those maps (<b><i>Linen Map Markup Mosaic</i></b>), and the Detroit parcel layer are used as base maps to create this data.</span></p><p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif;'>The spatial reference is: </span>WGS 1984 Web Mercator Auxiliary Sphere<br /></p><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif; font-size:11pt;'>The street and alley vacations were recorded from 1831 to 2022 throughout the whole city, and it will be updated weekly. The existed and/or active street and alley vacations are ready to view, the authors are working on pending and historical records.</span><div style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><font style='font-family:inherit;'><span style='font-family:inherit; font-size:14.6667px;'><br /></span></font><div style='font-family:inherit;'><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Red Features </b>- Have been "Outright" vacated, meaning the right of way has become private property with no restrictions.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><b>Green Features </b>- Have been vacated with reserve of a utility easement, meaning the right of way has become private property with access rights for utility companies.</div></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>Note: Special values within the 'Jurisdiction' field:</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>"2" means that the feature was approved under Jurisdiction of Wayne County, the State of Michigan, or a Township that was annexed by the City of Detroit, No City record on file. </div><div style='font-family:inherit;'><div>"1" means that the feature was approved under City of Detroit jurisdiction.</div><div>"0" means the feature was approved per circuit court decision.  No City record on file. </div></div></div>

style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><div><span style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><br /></span></div>This data represents legal agreements that the Department of Public Works has made with property owners related to the maintenance of certain streets and/or alleys.  Maintenance Agreements are created when the property owner has identified a certain street and/or alley as being critical to how the property operates.  Examples include using an alley for access to parking for a business, loading zones for commercial establishments, private improvements to streets and/or alleys that are not standard to City construction methods, and all other approved encroachments.  </span>

style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;'><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>Data provided by Detroit Health Department. </b></font></span></div><div><span style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;'><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>The public-facing COVID Cases Dashboard is hosted at: </b></font></span><a href='https://detroitmi.gov/departments/detroit-health-department' rel='nofollow ugc' target='_blank'>detroitmi.gov/health</a></div><div><span style='font-family:Slack-Lato, appleLogo, sans-serif; font-variant-ligatures:common-ligatures; color:rgb(29, 28, 29);'><br /></span></div><div><span style='font-family:Slack-Lato, appleLogo, sans-serif; font-variant-ligatures:common-ligatures; color:rgb(29, 28, 29);'>UPDATE* July 29 2021:</span><br /></div><div><font color='#1d1c1d' style='background-color:rgb(255, 255, 255);'><span style='font-family:Slack-Lato, appleLogo, sans-serif; font-variant-ligatures:common-ligatures;'>The underlying calculation for disease date was updated to allow for individuals to appear on the curve in multiple locations if they experienced more than one case of COVID-19 that was at least 90 days apart.</span><br /><span style='font-family:Slack-Lato, appleLogo, sans-serif; font-variant-ligatures:common-ligatures;'>Geospatial information analysis was also improved and additional criterial for address clean up were implemented, which leads to more accurate case counts within Zip Codes. Some unverified addresses that may have appeared in previous Zip Code counts are now excluded.</span><br /><span style='font-family:Slack-Lato, appleLogo, sans-serif; font-variant-ligatures:common-ligatures;'>This change discourages direct comparison of dashboard visualizations and counts prior to the new calculation, and non-significant shifts in numbers will be noticed.</span></font><span style='font-family:Montserrat; font-style:italic;'><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></span></div><div><span style='font-family:Montserrat; font-style:italic;'><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></span></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><span style='font-family:Montserrat; font-style:italic;'>Case numbers represent Detroit residents only. Some ZIP codes with very low case counts are excluded to protect privacy. Case counts are totals per ZIP code and are not adjusted for population. ZIP code totals are preliminary; addresses are updated as new information becomes available and counts are subject to change. Not all cases have an accurate location; only cases with a known ZIP code are represented. Where a ZIP code is split between cities, only the Detroit portion is shown (48203, 48211, 48212, 48236, 48239). The counts exclude cases among prisoners at the Wayne County Jail and known hospital or laboratory locations.</span><u><br /></u></font></div><div><u><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></u></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><u>ZIP_Code</u>: The USPS ZIP postal code </font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><u>Clipped_ZIP_Population</u>: The 2010 population of the ZIP code, clipped to include Detroit City residents only.</font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><u>ZIP_Case_Count</u>: The current cumulative count of Confirmed COVID cases within the ZIP code, since the beginning of the pandemic. (Have a "Confimed" case status in MDSS)</font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><u>ZIP_Death_Count</u>: The current cumulative count of Confirmed COVID cases within the ZIP code, since the beginning of the pandemic. (Have a "Confimed" case status in MDSS and are deceased)</font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><u>ZIP_Case_Rate</u>: Rate of confirmed cases per 100 thousand residents in the ZIP code. </font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>                           </b>For each zip, the rate was calculated by <b>(C/P)*100000</b> </font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>                           C</b> = the count of confirmed (MDSS case status = Confirmed) cases with</font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'>                                  a resident address in the ZIP code</font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>                           P</b> = the population count of the ZIP code</font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><br /></font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><u>ZIP_Death_Rate</u>: Rate of confirmed cases that were marked deceased, per 100 thousand residents in the ZIP code. </font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>                           </b>For each zip, the rate was calculated by <b>(D/P)*100000</b> </font></div><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>                           </b><b>D</b> = the count of confirmed (MDSS case status = Confirmed) cases<br /></font><div><font color='#000000' size='3'>                                  marked as deceased, with a resident address in the ZIP <b>          </b><b>                         </b></font></div><div><font color='#000000' size='3'><b>                           P</b> = the population count of the ZIP code</font></div>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      <div><div><div>\n  <div>This\n table shows all 911 police emergency response and officer-initiated \ncalls for service in the City of Detroit in the last 30 days. \nEmergency response calls are the result of people calling 911 to request\n police services. Officer-initiated calls include traffic stops, street \ninvestigations and other policing activities (such as observing crimes \nin progress) where police officers initiate the response. The table \nincludes all calls taken, dispatch, travel, and total response times for\n those calls serviced by a police agency. The data also include the \nresponding agency, unit, call type and category of each call. Should you\n have questions about this dataset, you may contact the Commanding \nOfficer of the Detroit Police Department's Crime Intelligence Unit at \n313-596-2250 or CrimeIntelligenceBureau@detroitmi.gov. </div>\n</div></div></div>

Health Policy (ORHP) designated rural health areas. MUA/P designations are based on the Index of Medical Underservice (IMU). IMU is calculated based on four criteria: population to provider ratio; percent of the population below the federal poverty level; percent of the population over age 65; and infant mortality rate.</span>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       <div>This\n data reflects reported criminal offenses that have occurred in the City\n of Detroit. Offense data was extracted from the Detroit Police \nDepartment's records management system. This data set contains the most \nrecent data available and is updated anytime DPD sends official crime \nrecords contributing to the Michigan Incident Crime Reporting (MICR) or \nthe National Incident Based Reporting systems (reflected by the IBR Date\n field). It should be noted that some incidents involve the commission \nof multiple offenses, such as a domestic assault where property was also\n vandalized. Accordingly, the data describe all offenses associated with\n all reported incidents.</div>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 <p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px; background-image:initial; background-position:initial; background-size:initial; background-repeat:initial; background-attachment:initial; background-origin:initial; background-clip:initial;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif; font-size:12pt;'>This data is intended as a reference material of street and alley openings, but not designed for survey, accurate positioning, or legal documents. It is created as polygon feature class, dedicated information based on field measurements, types of Right of Way, and citations of Journal of the Common Council (J.C.C.) and legal description are included. The paper maps of the Street and Alley Openings, the raster layer version of those maps (<b><i>Linen Map Markup Mosaic</i></b>), and the Detroit parcel layer are used as base maps to create this data.</span></p><p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px; background-image:initial; background-position:initial; background-size:initial; background-repeat:initial; background-attachment:initial; background-origin:initial; background-clip:initial;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif; font-size:12pt;'>The spatial reference is: </span><span style='font-family:"inherit", serif; font-size:12pt;'>WGS 1984 Web Mercator Auxiliary Sphere</span></p><p style='margin-top:0px; margin-bottom:1.5rem; font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px; background-image:initial; background-position:initial; background-size:initial; background-repeat:initial; background-attachment:initial; background-origin:initial; background-clip:initial;'><span style='font-family:"Times New Roman", serif; font-size:12pt;'>The street and alley openings were recorded from 1831 to 2022 throughout the whole city, and it will be updated weekly. The existed and/or active street and alley openings are ready to view, the authors are working on missing and historical records.</span></p><div style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'>Note: Special values within the 'Jurisdiction' field:</div><div style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><br /></div><div style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'>"2" means that the feature was approved under Wayne County or the State of Michigan jurisdiction, No City record on file. </div><div style='font-family:"Avenir Next W01", "Avenir Next W00", "Avenir Next", Avenir, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif; font-size:16px;'><div style='font-family:inherit;'>"1" means that the feature was approved under City of Detroit jurisdiction.</div><div style='font-family:inherit;'>"0" means the feature was approved per circuit court decision.  No City record on file. </div></div>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       This table shows all 911 police emergency response and officer-initiated\n calls for service in the City of Detroit since September 20, 2016. \nEmergency response calls are the result of people calling 911 to request\n police services. Officer-initiated calls include traffic stops, street \ninvestigations and other policing activities (such as observing crimes \nin progress) where police officers initiate the response. The table \nincludes all calls taken, dispatch, travel, and total response times for\n those calls serviced by a police agency. The data also include the \nresponding agency, unit, call type and category of each call. Should you\n have questions about this dataset, you may contact the Commanding \nOfficer of the Detroit Police Department's Crime Intelligence Unit at \n313-596-2250 or CrimeIntelligenceBureau@detroitmi.gov.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       The Detroit specific BRFSS data is drawn from the Michigan Behavioral Risk Factor Survey (MiBRFS), an annual, statewide telephone survey of Michigan adults aged 18 years and older that is conducted through a collaborative effort among the Population Health Surveillance Branch (PHSB) of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Michigan State University Institute for Public Policy and Social Research (IPPSR), and the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services. Michigan BRFS data contribute to the national Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System that is managed by the PHSB at the CDC.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      <h3>A building permit is the approval given by the Buildings, Safety, \nEngineering and Environmental Department (BSEED) to complete work on a \nbuilding according to City Codes and State of Michigan Construction \nCodes. \n</h3><br /><div><h1 style='font-size:18px;'><b>Column definitions</b></h1><br /><h2><b>record_id</b></h2><p>Unique identifier used to track this permit within BSEED's Accela database.</p><br /><h2><b>street_num</b></h2><p>Street number of the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2><b>street_dir</b></h2><p>Street direction of the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2><b>street_name</b></h2><p>Street name of the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2><b>street_type</b></h2><p>Street type for the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2><b>submitted_date</b></h2><p>Date the application was received. Applications are submitted to BSEED by property owners or licensed professionals.</p><br /><h2><b>issued_date</b></h2><p>Date the permit was issued. The permit is issued when the permit application is approved. Permits are issued by BSEED staff.</p><br /><h2><b>days_to_complete</b></h2><p>Number\n of days the permit holder was given to complete activities articulated \nin the permit. The permit holder is generally given 6 months to complete\n the permit work and more time if there are consistent inspection \nactivities.</p><br /><h2><b>status</b></h2><p>Current status of the permit. All records provided here have a status of Issued.</p><br /><h2><b>amount</b></h2><p>This is the amount the permit applicant was required to pay for the permit.</p><br /><h2><b>current_legal_use</b></h2><p>The\n building's current Type of Use. It is defined by the Michigan Building \nCode in conjunction with the City of Detroit Zoning Ordinance.</p><br /><h2><b>stories</b></h2><p>Stories is the total number of floors in the building. Permits may be issued for individual floors or groups of floors.</p><br /><h2><b>zoning_district</b></h2><p>The\n type of zoning district where the building is located. The City of \nDetroit Zoning Ordinance is written by the City Planning Commission and \napproved by City Council.</p><br /><h2><b>proposed_use</b></h2><p>The\n Type of Use that the permit applicant proposed for the relevant \nbuilding space after the permitted work is completed. The Type of Use is\n defined by the Michigan Building Code in conjunction with the City of \nDetroit Zoning Ordinance.</p><br /><h2><b>type_of_construction</b></h2><p>The\n type of construction activity according to the Michigan Building Code. \nThey are the types of construction used to erect buildings. There are \nfive types and nine sub-categories.</p><br /><h2><b>permit_type</b></h2><p>The category of building permit that was issued.</p><br /><h2><b>description_of_work</b></h2><p>Notes\n and further specifications about the building permit. They may contain \ndetails about the location information, related grants, or related \nbuilding permits.</p><br /><h2><b>parcel_id</b></h2><p>Unique \nnumber used to track the parcel of land the building is located on. \nParcel IDs are assigned by the Office of the Assessor.</p></div>

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    <h3>A Business License is the City’s stamp of approval for a business to operate within the city limits. The business licenses are used for certifying the type of business and that they may operate in the city at that location per the Zoning Ordinance.\n</h3><br /><div><h1 style='font-size: 18px;'><strong>Column definitions</strong></h1><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>business_id</strong></h2><p>Unique identifier used to track this business within BSEED's Accela database.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_num</strong></h2><p>Street number of the property address where either the business is located or another location where the business owner conducts business.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_dir</strong></h2><p>Street direction of the property address where either the business is located or another location where the business owner conducts business.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_name</strong></h2><p>Street name of the property address where either the business is located or another location where the business owner conducts business.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_type</strong></h2><p>Street type of the property address where either the business is located or another location where the business owner conducts business.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>business_name</strong></h2><p>The name of the business, which could be the Doing Business As (DBA) name, an affiliated Limited Liability Company (LLC) or a personal name.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>business_type</strong></h2><p>The type of the business as defined by Detroit City Code.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>parcel_id</strong></h2><p>Unique number used to track the parcel of land the business is located on. Parcel IDs are assigned by the Office of the Assessor.</p><br /></div>

74                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      <h3>A demolition permit, also sometimes known as a wrecking permit, is required for the wrecking or tearing down of any building or other structure in Detroit. A licensed professional wrecking contractor or in some cases the property owner (size of property restriction) can apply for a demo/wrecking permit. The demolition permit application is submitted to BSEED for approval. Additional demolition-related requirements regarding lead and asbestos abatement are enforced by other agencies. This information is tracked for compliance, safety and property assessment.\n</h3><br /><div><h1 style='font-size: 18px;'><strong>Column definitions</strong></h1><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>record_id</strong></h2><p>Unique identifier used to track this permit within BSEED's Accela database.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_num</strong></h2><p>Street number of the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_dir</strong></h2><p>Street direction of the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_name</strong></h2><p>Street name of the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>street_type</strong></h2><p>Street type for the property address where the permit was issued.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>date_status</strong></h2><p>Date when the status went into effect.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>description</strong></h2><p>The type of work that is being completed on the building at the location.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>owner_name</strong></h2><p>Name of the property owner when the demolition permit was issued.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>contractor_name</strong></h2><p>Name of the licensed professional who will be performing the demolition.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>contractor_business_name</strong></h2><p>Business name of the licensed professionals who will be performing the demolition.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>contractor_address</strong></h2><p>Business street address of the licensed professionals who will be performing the demolition.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>task</strong></h2><p>Current task for the permit within BSEED's Accela database. All records provided here have a task of 'Permit Issuance'.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>status</strong></h2><p>Current status of the permit. All records provided here have a status of 'Issued'.</p><br /><h2 style='text-size: 12px;'><strong>parcel_id</strong></h2><p>Unique number used to track the parcel of land the building is located on. Parcel IDs are assigned by the Office of the Assessor.</p><br /></div>
